title: Iggy.rs – building message streaming in Rust
dot:
digraph IggyOverview{node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];Origins[label="Origins
- Started learning Rust
- Previous project failed
- Realized need for a real project"];Project[label="Project
- Early version with QUIC protocol
- Message streaming platform
- Built with Rust, focus on performance"];Team[label="Team
- 10 members
- Open source contributors
- Shared passion for programming"];Features[label="Features
- High throughput and low latency
- Multiple transport protocols (QUIC, TCP, HTTP)
- Consumer groups, message expiry
- CLI & Web UI"];Roadmap[label="Roadmap
- Clustering (Raft)
- Low-level I/O (io_uring)
- Thread-per-core architecture"];Future[label="Future
- General-purpose tool like Kafka
- Push hardware and OS limits
- Unified platform with modern UI"];Origins->Project[label="Led to"];Project->Team[label="Grew with team effort"];Team->Features[label="Built key features"];Features->Roadmap[label="Drive future development"];Roadmap->Future[label="Goals for the future"]; subgraph cluster_Origins{label="Iggy.rs Origins";style=dashed;Origins;}subgraph cluster_Project{label="Iggy.rs Project";style=dotted;Project;}subgraph cluster_Team{label="Iggy.rs Team";style=dotted;Team;}subgraph cluster_Features{label="Iggy.rs Features";style=dotted;Features;}subgraph cluster_Roadmap{label="Iggy.rs Roadmap";style=dotted;Roadmap;}subgraph cluster_Future{label="Iggy.rs Future";style=dotted;Future;}}
